"One called out, "Don't suppose you know of any monster infested caves nearby?""
"No," Javlyn called back, "Though there is a friendly creature here. Please leave it alone, it just wants the mushrooms."
"Javlyn listened curiously as they discussed magical workings gone wrong and things beyond her understanding until finally, she interrupted."

Tearing off her leather jerkin, she wrapped the bones to form a draggable litter.
She used her belt to make a chest strap and then began to move as quickly as possible back down the passageway towards the cave entrance.
She pulled with all her might, pushing against the ground and the chest strap, making plenty of noise as she grunted and ground the litter across the rocky path.

Javlyn gave up on the litter and drug Jerrick with all her might.
Her back screamed in pain.
But there was no time to pause, no time to listen, no time to think.
The only thing Javlyn could hear now was her own heart pounding in her ears and the sound of Jerrick sliding, slowly, too slowly over the ground.
Bit by hard-won bit, Javlyn made her way down the passage as it slowly brightened.
"No time to explain," Javlyn managed to say between heavy breaths, "we have to go. Now."
